intro: Capanemia angustilabia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf capanemia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant diversity in the region.
